channel.title: Crysis 3
channel.description:
![](upload://ue3z5CwA5Fr8zpxs2HbkapyxOzK.jpeg)
- Overkill Pack - Upgrades - Hunter edition - Bonus - DLC
EA does it again, making DLC's before the game is actually even announced. Crysis 2 was a turd, Crysis 3 will be a mega turd ?

item.title: Crysis 3
item.dc:creator: Shepard
item.description:
Maxey:

Both teams are CELL. Why are they hunting their own men?

So after apocalypse not many humans left, but there’s still evil corporation that kills them. But after they killed everyone or just got bored, they’re start to fucking kill each other.

This plot is getting better and better.

P.S. Trailer looks fantastic.

Read full topic

item.title: Crysis 3
item.dc:creator: AlphaPromethean
item.description:
sigh well, its to be expected from EA. Anyway, I hope it’s more like Crysis 1, I liked that game, but Crysis 2 felt different somehow.

The Cryengine looks as beautiful as ever, my PC should be able to run it on high settings with the new parts I’m getting, even though the gameplay for crysis is generally pretty mediocre, the environment never ceases to impress.

Read full topic

item.title: Crysis 3
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
King_Kaddo:

It looks awesome but I couldn’t play with that much depth of field, grain and probably motion blur. So much blurriness plus a low framerate gets an instant headache for me. It looks more like a movie.

This.

Bokeh depth of field, chromatic aberration, lens flare, film grain, and what looks like TXAA or FXAA (gross). The field of view seems pretty low as well.
It’d be fine if they were making a movie, but in a game it just results in blurriness and a less immersive experience overall.

Everything else looks pretty damn good, though.

EDIT: Watched another trailer, not a fan of the ‘crap-on-visor/helmet/camera lens’ effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Crysis 3
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
New trailer - Multiplayer

I have to say, this does look pretty fucking cool. It’s like the Predator gametypes for Halo 3, except with more specific behaviors. I loved those custom gametypes, so I can’t imagine this being bad in any way. The only thing that could fuck it up is if the prey respawns on the hunter’s side after they’re killed. That would be ridiculously unbalanced considering what the hunters seem to be capable of.

Read full topic

item.title: Crysis 3
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
o herrow!:

Fear 3 is a good example if you’ve ever played that…the storyline goes right off into videogame lala land near the end of the game.

Near the end? That game didn’t make any fucking sense from minute one. They resurrected Paxton Fettel as a Geist like apparition figure that gets all chummy with the continually mute Point Man. The co-op gameplay focus ruined the entire story and the gameplay- F.E.A.R. 3 simply wasn’t scary in the slightest. If anything, I thought it was hilarious at times, by nature of Fettel letting out deadpan wisecracks worthy of Horatio Caine.

For me, there is only one game in the Condemned and F.E.A.R. series for a reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Crysis 3
item.dc:creator: o_herrow
item.description:
k3nny1550:

Also, why the fuck is CELL in Crysis 3 anyway? They were supposedly shut down by the USMC and labelled criminals. (Someone pointed this out in a previous post, and it really should be answered)

Crysis seems to be going the route of other games in that the sequels have increasingly stupider plots. Fear 3 is a good example if you’ve ever played that…the storyline goes right off into videogame lala land near the end of the game. Crysis 3 looks like they decided right from the start that they wanted all these strange environments and THEN had to shoehorn in this awkward plot that justifies why any of this should make sense instead of the other way around. I’d suggest enjoying the game for its entertainment value and not expecting even a coherent storyline.

Read full topic

item.title: Crysis 3
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Look at the stupid hexagon emblems on that XM8 clone. They managed to cover up the “Y” in Safety, which isn’t anywhere near a trigger group or fire selection switch. (The actual selector is marked with bullet icons) Is it supposed to be CELL iconography or something?

Also, why the fuck is CELL in Crysis 3 anyway? They were supposedly shut down by the USMC and labelled criminals. (Someone pointed this out in a previous post, and it really should be answered)

Read full topic

other than that, pure fucking beauty… alright, god damn it how the fuck does the suit cloak work on the gun you’re holding? The cinematic where they close up on how it works doesn’t explain that at all D:
